intro: Curcuma putii, commonly known as the purple ginger, is a rhizomatous herbaceous plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the Zingiberaceae family and is characterized by its striking purple flowers and ornamental leaves. The plant typically grows to a height of 1–2 meters and thrives in tropical and subtropical climates. Its rhizomes are often used in traditional medicine and can have various bioactive compounds. The botanical features of Curcuma putii make it both an ornamental and potentially medicinal plant.
